column4: I'm hoping somebody can help me identify the package I should file a bug against
I'm deploying a fleet of laptops and using pxe boot & preseed
in the process I'm creating an admin user and setting a root password
when I deploy laptops, I create new accounts and give them sudo privileges
these new user accounts can use sudo or gksudo just fine
what they cannot do is successfully get things like the automatic prompts for password when updates are available to work
or, for example, when firefox prompts for the install of flash
is your sudoers file default still?
yes. no change there.
what groups are they in? or are they exactly like the default first user created during setup?
all the boxes under the "User Privileges" tab after "Advanced Settings" button in the GUI interface
they are in all the groups as the initial user, plus a few more
what about startup in the background processes?  some gnome/kde utility...
I'm not sure I understand the question
i would think so
i was thinking it was an issue of the popup for updates not appearing at all, so the user is never prompted for them
nono, the user is definitely prompted for updates, which is the main time when we see this bug.
ah
mebbe i shouldn't have had that second beer :)
but pulling something out of my butt, can you write a wrapper shell script that calls gksudo manually to start update-manager?
I don't need to if people are going to initiate things; they can just use gksudo
the issue is that when they are prompted by any interface to elevate their privs where they didn't start explicitly with gksudo
for example, when they are prompted for updates. Or when they click on the software center from the application menu
ah...
